items.title: US demands EU reverse new climate rules to allow surge in gas imports
bullets: • US and Qatar, two of the three largest LNG exporters in the world, sent a letter to the European Union
• The EU should either completely repeal or substantially cut back the new rules, according to the letter
• The directive requires gas exporters to the 27-country bloc to show they protect human rights and are cutting their planet-heating emissions

items.title: Scientists make yogurt using ants. The result: tangy and herby
bullets: • Scientists make yogurt using ants
• The result: tangy and herby
• The research team said the yogurt was just barely clumpy at the bottom of the jar
• That's because the ants have their own microbiome that includes lactic acid used in fermentation

items.title: Iceland reports the presence of mosquitoes for the first time, as climate warms
bullets: • Iceland reports the presence of mosquitoes for the first time in its history
• The discovery of three Culiseta annulata mosquitoes was confirmed by the Natural Science Institute of Iceland
• Antarctica is now the only place in the world believed to have no mosquitoes

items.title: ‘We found 23,000 worms!’ The soil project bringing life back to the land
bullets: • Soil is the second largest carbon store after the oceans, but it’s being steadily degraded
• Deforestation, intensive agriculture, urbanisation and pollution have decimated the soil
• One farming community is pioneering a soil health project to show how organic regenerative agriculture can restore this vital ecosystem

items.title: Cuban man deported from US to Eswatini goes on hunger strike in prison
bullets: • Roberto Mosquera del Peral was among five third-country nationals deported from the US to Eswatini in July
• They have been held in a maximum-security prison along with 10 others deported in October
• US officials have said the men deported are convicted criminals
• Their lawyers say all of them had finished serving their sentences in the US and there was no legal basis to imprison them again

• Too often, patriotism has been used as a tool of division rather than unity - defined from podium rather than people

items.title: Mental exercise can reverse a brain change linked to aging, study finds
bullets: • A Montreal neurologist says cognitive training can boost levels of a brain chemical that typically declines with age
• The increase "is not huge," says Étienne de Villers-Sidani, a neurologist at McGill University in Montreal
• It's significant, considering that you get a 2.5% decrease per decade normally just with aging, he says

items.title: Found Footage Horror ‘Project Butterfly: Flatwoods’ Coming Halloween Night 2025!
bullets: • Project Butterfly: Flatwoods is a found footage horror film set during the lunar eclipse of 2004, in Flatwoods, West Virginia
• The film follows three students who are filming a school project centered around an investigation that eventually leads them to a government bunker connected to cryptid experimentation
• The further the students dig, the more they uncover the terrifying truths of this bunker

items.title: Neato’s cloud is shutting down, leaving its robovacs stuck in manual mode
bullets: • Users are receiving emails notifying them that their robot vacuum cleaners will no longer have access to cloud services
• This comes two years after US-based Neato Robotics closed up shop in 2023
• The company that purchased Neato robovacs, Vorwerk, is reneging on its promise to keep the bots’ server running for 5 years

items.title: Nike is trying to sell you ‘mind-body’ shoes
bullets: • Nike's new “neuroscience-based footwear” is designed to activate an athlete’s brain before and after a big game
• The two shoes, a mule (the $95 Mind 001) and a lace-up sneaker, feature a distinctive array of 22 orange foam nodes embedded in each sole
• Nike says the nodes each move up and down independently, like “pistons and gimbals” as the athlete walks
